trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Panopto | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Panopto | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Panopto with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Panopto with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Panopto
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Panopto

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Panopto.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Panopto.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Panopto tenant
trans-unit.target: A Panopto tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Panopto will be able to single sign into the application at your Panopto company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Panopto will be able to single sign into the application at your Panopto company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Panopto
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Panopto

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Panopto
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Panopto

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Panopto.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Panopto.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Panopto, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Panopto, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Panopto.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Panopto.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Appkication Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Appkication Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Panopto, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Panopto, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Panopto</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Panopto</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Panopto with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Panopto with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Panopto application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Panopto application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Panopto page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Panopto page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Panopto Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "*https://\. Panopto.com*", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Panopto Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "*https://\. Panopto.com*", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Panopto page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Panopto page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Panopto company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Panopto company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the left, click System, and then click Identity Providers.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the left, click System, and then click Identity Providers.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>System</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>System</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add Provider.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Provider.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Identity Providers</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Identity Providers</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the SAML provider section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the SAML provider section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SaaS configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SaaS configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Provider Type list, select SAML20
trans-unit.target: From the Provider Type list, select SAML20

trans-unit.source: In the Instance Name textbox, type a name for the instance.
trans-unit.target: In the Instance Name textbox, type a name for the instance.

trans-unit.source: In the Friendly Description textbox, type a friendly description.
trans-unit.target: In the Friendly Description textbox, type a friendly description.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Panopto dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Panopto dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Panopto dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the Bounce Page Url textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Panopto dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the Bounce Page Url textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Public Key textbox
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Public Key textbox

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Save</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Save</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Panopto.
trans-unit.target: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Panopto.

trans-unit.source: When an assigned user tries to log into Panopto using the access panel, Panopto checks whether the user exists.
trans-unit.target: When an assigned user tries to log into Panopto using the access panel, Panopto checks whether the user exists.

trans-unit.source: If there is no user account available yet, it is automatically created by Panopto.
trans-unit.target: If there is no user account available yet, it is automatically created by Panopto.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Panopto user account creation tools or APIs provided by Panopto to provision Azure AD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Panopto user account creation tools or APIs provided by Panopto to provision Azure AD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Panopto, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Panopto, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Panopto **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Panopto **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
